results.title: Good Will Hunting (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Lawrence Bender and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend, and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)

results.title: Good value
results.brief_description: A World War Two propaganda film highlighting Britain’s proud tradition of craftmanship including the making of Whitney blankets, Sheffield knives and electric light globes.

results.title: Good times two
results.creator_credit: Michael G. Ryan, Oxley Hughan, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film tells of the adventures of two Australian girls on a flying visit to New Zealand. As they travel the country the girls are seen against a giant backdrop - New Zealand itself. Nearly all of it is shown - forests, farms, the rivers and lakes, ski-fields, and beaches, the volcanoes, and the cities…a lively introduction to New Zealand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael G. Ryan, Oxley Hughan, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Good time skiing
results.creator_credit: Bill Snider, Len Aitken and Crystal Productions
results.brief_description: Portrays cross-country skiing as a pleasure sport as well as an Olympic event. Pleasure skiers are shown traversing magnificent mountain country inaccessible to hikers and down-hill skiers; and skiers in turn of the century costume are seen using telemark turns to ski deep powder snow. The film also demonstrates techniques used by the Olympic team which will enhance the skills of, and provide additional pleasure to Nordic skiers. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Good things come in small packages
results.creator_credit: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sam came up to Leeanne Hill and asked her for a hug, a friendship started that has only become stronger over the years. These best friends are there for each other through everything, including Hill’s struggle with Turner’s Syndrome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Good speech for Gary
results.creator_credit: Bud Hollzer, Wilbur T. Blume, McGraw-Hill Films and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: Shows techniques of speech therapy used in a Californian class. Helps of all kinds are provided in the context of well-planned activities. Problems peculiar to individual children are dealt with by combined work of speech therapists, teachers, parents and health officials. Gives concrete suggestions (in the form of games and group activities) for correcting poor speech.

results.title: Good soldier Swejk
results.creator_credit: Jiri Trnka and Czechoslovak State Film
results.brief_description:
Featuring Czech puppet animation, this film consists of three episodes in the life of a Swejk - a solider famous in Czech folklore for his awkward ways and clashes with authority. A satire on militarism, “Good Soldier Swejk” is a sly critique of army life depicted with puppets, which were Czech animator Jiri Trnka’s speciality. Swekj has a talent for unsettling his superiors, showing them up for the inept militarists that they are, whilst remaining blissfully unaware of his misdeeds. Episode one: Swejk is sent to buy a black market bottle of cognac for his superior. When he is caught by another officer he is forced to pretend the cognac is water and drink the whole bottle in one go. Episode 2: Swejk takes a train journey with his superior and earns his wrath for rambling on endlessly with various stories that upset those around him. Swejk is arrested when he decides to pull the emergency brake in order to determine that it works. Episode 3: Having misplaced his regiment, Swejk is arrested on suspicion of being a Russian spy whereupon a top criminologist interrogates him. Several officers guarding him proceed to get drunk and sentimental about the fate of their prisoner before escorting him to the courthouse.

Credits: Director, writer, Jiri Trnka ; photography, E. Franek ; music, Vaclav Trojan; editing, H. Lebduskova ; animation, B. Sramek , B. Pojar, J. Karpas.

results.title: Good record keeping
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the requirements and importance of good record keeping for the New Tax System, implemented July 1, 2000. Presented by Michael Caton. Covers and defines such topics as: Acquisitions ; Australian Business Number ; Business Activity Statement ; GST-free ; Input taxed ; Input tax credit ; PAYG instalments ; PAYG withholding ; Supplies ; Taxable supplies ; Tax period.
